extends Trade
implements java.io.Serializable

      Constructors

      Creates a trade with an item that both the seller wants to sell and the buyer wants to buy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PermTrade

        public PermTrade(java.lang.String traderA,
                 java.lang.String traderB,
                 java.util.List<Item> userAItemsToTrade,
                 java.util.List<Item> userBItemsToTrade,
                 java.time.LocalDateTime startDate)
        Creates a trade with an item that both the seller wants to sell and the buyer wants to buy. The buyer creates the trade with the item that they want to sell. NOTE: userAItemsToTrade and userBItemsToTrade must not be empty at the same time. It will lead to very bad things.
        Parameters:
        traderA - takes in a entities.User that wants to create the entities.Trade.
        traderB - takes in a entities.User that wants to borrow the item based on the trade.
        userAItemsToTrade - takes in items that want to be traded to userB.
        userBItemsToTrade - takes in items that want to be traded to userA.
        startDate - is a LocalDateTime that follows a start date of a trade. Note: this can be used for invoicing once a trade is completed.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleted

        public boolean getCompleted()
        Determines whether a trade is completed based on the number of times both traders confirm the TradeRequest details. In this class, each trader needs to confirm once in order for the trade to be completed.
        Specified by:
        getCompleted in class Trade
        Returns:
        a boolean on whether a trade is completed or not.

      • setConfirm

        public void setConfirm(java.lang.String traderName,
                       boolean confirmation)
        Confirms a meeting for the user if they are part of a trade. If they are not part of a trade then an exception is thrown!
        Specified by:
        setConfirm in class Trade
        Parameters:
        traderName - takes in a String that determines if they are part of the trade.
        confirmation - takes a boolean that determines if they confirmed the meeting.

      • daysLeft

        public int daysLeft()
        This method provides you with the number of days left after a trade has been processed.
        Returns:
        an integer that indicates the number of days left in the trade.
